alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 3:01PM MST until December 20 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST... .A winter storm will spread snow into the Cascades Friday night with snow becoming heavy Saturday morning through Saturday night. Travel will be difficult over Stevens Pass with this winter storm. Snow is expected to decrease by late Sunday morning. Snow will spread east impacting eastern Washington and northern Idaho including the Spokane to Coeur d`Alene metro areas. Heavy snow will persist in the Idaho Panhandle mountains into early next week. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 10 inches in the Silver Valley and 8 to 12 inches in the central Idaho mountains. For the Idaho Palouse 4 to 8 inches are possible. For the northeast Blue mountains 5 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Potlatch, Dobson Pass, Plummer, Wallace, Fourth Of July Pass, Anatone, Moscow, Osburn, Peola, Genesee, Mountain Road, Kellogg, St. Maries, Cloverland Road, Fernwood, Lookout Pass, Mullan, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
